New Records: South Africa defended the lowest total (114) in a T20 World Cup match
Keshav Maharaj took 3 wickets and 27 runs in 4 overs
Heinrich Klaasen scored 46 runs off 44 balls
Key Match Events: Mahmudullah was caught on the boundary on the penultimate ball
Taskin Ahmed could only manage one run off the last ball
David Miller came up with another rescue job after his half-century
The game was high-pressure with Bangladesh needing six runs off the final two balls
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa had successfully defended low totals in previous matches
The match was a high-pressure game for both teams
South Africa's strategy involved applying information from the last game
Post-Match Reflections: Heinrich Klaasen expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The victory was a pivotal moment in South Africa's playoff push
Maharaj's left-arm spin turned the game in the final over
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the lowest target ever defended in a T20 World Cup
South Africa completed the group stage against Nepal on Friday
Bangladesh has the Netherlands on Thursday
